case_title: ASMAT ULLAH vs REGISTRAR TRADE UNION BALOCHISTAN, QUETTA and 2 others
key_issues: Election dispute between two panels of Livestock Peoples Workers Union.
Allegations of rigging and unfair polling practices.
Clerical error in official documents regarding election dates.

judgment_summary.initial_election_dispute: Election held under supervision of retired officer challenged in Labour Court.
judgment_summary.labour_court_decision: Fresh election ordered under Registrar Trade Union supervision.
judgment_summary.tribunal_decision: Labour Court's decision upheld; appeal dismissed.
judgment_summary.high_court_decision: Fresh election schedule ordered with extended nomination submission time.
judgment_summary.current_appeal: Appellant challenged re-election order for 10 polling stations due to alleged rigging and procedural errors.

directions.remand_order: Matter remanded to Presiding Officer 1st Labour Court Balochistan for framing issues and recording evidence.
directions.timeline: Proceedings to be conducted on a day-to-day basis for timely resolution.

remarks: Parties to bear their own costs. Original record to be sent to trial court.
